item.title: Data Science Projects
item.description: This is a collection of open source datasets that I’ve analysed in my free time. I share my results in the form of jupyter notebooks, which I share on my GitHub.

item.title: Correct-a-Spine
item.description: Part of IC HealthHack 2019 - myself and 3 others built a wearable posture monitoring device for dynamically monitoring user posture and preventing spinal injury. Check out the Devpost!

item.title: Over EASI
item.description: Over-EASI is a web app interface for clinicians and researchers to upload and manage paients' scored Eczema images. You can view the website here. Over-EASI was built with React, Bootstrap, Java and PostgreSQL.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: I decided to make this site so I could have a single place on the internet where I can access and share information about myself and things that I’ve worked on. Instead of having to go to my GitHub or my project page, it’s all here now. How did I make this site? In all honesty, I didn’t. My goal here isn’t to come up with some fancy website with really cool features (if you’re looking for one of those, check this out) - I just wanted a space on the internet to house my projects, CV, a blog and my contact details.
